doc.title: GS Basics - ISM Ahead. Goldilocks and Bankruptcies. Belly Inflation Takes Off.
doc.source_uri: 2025-09-02/GS Basics - ISM Ahead. Goldilocks and Bankruptcies. Belly Inflation Takes Off. 高盛基础 - ISM 即将公布。金发姑娘与 破产潮。中段通胀起飞。_2025-09-02

passages.text: Market Insights | Markets | Equities市场洞察|市场|股票

Overnight/Asia... Quiet in Europe yesterday with the U.S. holiday... but Asia/China stayed volatile. SHCOMP and HSI giving back part of yesterday's gains as investors locked in profits. China tech/data-center/Al/smartphone-supply complex traded heavy (several bellwethers off \~2- 5%), though many remain up double digits over one month. NKY near unchen even as the 10- yr JGB auction was well bid and BOJ commentary relatively dovish (BOJ Deputy Chief Himino "steers clear of hinting rate hike timing" -bbg).
隔夜/亚洲......由于美国假期，昨日欧洲市场平静......但亚洲/中国依然波动较大。上证综指和恒生指数回吐了昨日部分涨幅，因投资者锁定利润。中国科技/数据中心/人工智能/智能手机供应链板块承压（多只龙头股下跌约2- 5%），尽管许多股票在过去一个月仍上涨了两位数。日经指数几乎持平，即便10年期日本国债拍卖需求旺盛且日本央行言论相对鸽派（日本央行副行长永见野“避免暗示加息时机”——彭博）。

Gold/Inflation... Gold is breaking out to fresh highs, while the belly of the inflation curve has been firming (see below). Fed independence feels like a bigger risk than the market is pricing. Bessent: "The S&P's at a new high and bond yields are fine. So we haven't seen anything yet" ... challenge accepted. The dollar really should be lower... but European risks (France's confidence vote) and persistent UK budget questions at the long end suggest a balancing act rather than a one- way dollar story (+ dovish BOJ overnight). When does bond vol pick up?

黄金/通胀......黄金正突破至新高，而通胀曲线中段一直在走强（见下文）。美联储的独立性似乎是一个比市场定价更大的风险。Bessent: "标普指数创下新高，债券收益率也没问题。所以我们还什么都没看到"......接受挑战。美元本该更低......但欧洲风险（法国的不信任投票）以及英国长期预算问题的持续存在，暗示这是一种平衡行为，而不是单向的美元走势（+日本央行隔夜偏鸽）。债券波动率何时会抬头？

Today: ISM manufacturing...GIR view sits a touch above consensus. Think market will be hopeful for a firmer print as the equity market is pricing rate cuts into strength, not cuts into weakness (despite previous NFP). Glass half full... Much of the

labor/survey/consumer soft patch looked driven by record policy and trade uncertainty; as acute uncertainty recedes from its peaks, confidence and spend (and maybe hiring) should begin to recover. Financial conditions are already very loose (+Fed cutting cycle ahead), which in theory should lead a recovery in the data... small- cap/cyclical equity optimism seems to be clearly pricing a combination of both. Glass half empty... Tariffs are at multi- decade/even century- scale highs by some estimates, it's a regressive tax that will lean against growth and real incomes. The rebound we're seeing could be a reflexive burst rather than something durable if tariff drag and policy noise persist.

今天：ISM制造业......GIR的观点略高于市场一致预期。市场可能会希望数据更强劲一些，因为股市是在将降息定价为经济走强的背景下，而不是经济走弱的背景下（尽管此前的非农就业数据如此）。乐观的一面......许多劳动力/调查/消费者的疲软阶段似乎是由创纪录的政策和贸易不确定性驱动的；随着这种高度不确定性从峰值回落，信心和支出（甚至可能包括招聘）应会开始恢复。金融环境已经非常宽松（加上美联储即将进入降息周期），理论上应会带动数据回升......小盘股/周期性股票的乐观情绪似乎明显在同时定价这两种因素。悲观的一面......据一些估计，关税已处于数十年甚至百年来的高位，这是一种累退税，将抑制增长和实际收入。如果关税拖累和政策噪音持续存在，我们所看到的反弹可能只是一次反射性爆发，而非持久的复苏。

Seasonality & supply: We are officially on the other side of Labor Day... September often gets tricky. Part of the reason: both ECM and DCM tend to crank back up as desks return; IG/HY issuance typically ramps and can test spreads at tight levels. Expect an uptick in equity/credit primary and secondary paper into Sep expiry. Credit sidebar... Charts doing the rounds on bankruptcies aren't wrong: 2025's pace is tracking the highest since 2010. (63 US corporate bankruptcies in June set up 2025 for highest pace since 2010 | S&P Global) HY spreads remain well- behaved relative to equities, which likely reflects the ultra- low default baseline of the past decade, strong corporate balance sheets and massive influx into private credit post covid...that said its a curious moment for economy/credit cycle which could either lean back toward strength or show more persistent signs of deceleration.

季节性与供给：我们已经正式进入劳动节之后的阶段......九月往往会变得棘手。部分原因在于：随着交易台回归，ECM和DCM往往会重新启动；投资级/高收益债发行通常会加速，并可能在利差处于紧水率时受到考验。预计在九月到期前，股票/信贷一级和二级市场的发行都会有所增加。信贷方面的补充......近期流传的破产数据图表并没有错：2025年的节奏正追踪自2010年以来的最高水平。（2025年的节奏有望创下自2010年以来最高|S&P Global，6月美国企业破产3起）高收益债利差相较于股票依然表现稳定，这可能反映了过去十年超低的违约基准...强劲的企业资产负债表，以及疫情后大量资金流入私人信贷......话虽如此，目前的经济/信贷周期处于一个微妙时刻，既可能重新倾向于走强，也可能出现更持久的放缓迹象。

Positioning/Technicals... From here the technical mix keeps me sidelined/pessimistic near term... seasonality, maxed- out vol- control/cta demand, VIX vs fixed- strike supply causing short skew dynamics, liquidity drag to quarter end (see XBT relative) and the return of corporate issuance. It's a narrow plank to walk this week to maintain the thematic of "rate cuts into a strong/resilient economy" as that's largely what's priced into cyclical equities and front end rates. We need goldilocks data that is not too hot to remove accommodation (think equities might sputter on that a bit but ultimately
will be well supported) but not too cold to reprice growth (bigger worry). Watching ISM today.

定位/技术面......从目前来看，技术因素的组合比我在短期内保持观望/悲观......季节性因素、波动率控制/CTA需求已达上限、VIX与固定执行供给之间引发的空头偏斜动态、季度末的流动性拖累（参见XBT的相对表现）以及企业发行的回归。本周要维持“降息叠加强劲/有韧性的经济”这一主题，可谓走在一条狭窄的钢丝上，因为这基本上已经反映在周期性股票和前端利率的定价中。我们需要“恰到好处”的数据——既不能过热以至于撤回宽松（我认为股市可能会因此有些波动，但最终仍会得到良好支撑），也不能过冷以至于重新定价增长（这是更大的担忧）。今天关注ISM数据。

Side- note: "...the outperformance of belly breakevens has been a more consistent expression for concerns around Fed independence. On a beta- weighted basis to nominal rates, 5y inflation swaps continue to reprice towards new post- pandemic highs, and while some of this is attributable to the very front- end fixings, belly forwards (e.g. 2y1y) have also participated. The repricing has taken 5y inflation pricing somewhat \~15bp rich relative to our fair value model, although historically this degree of richness is far from unusual. In contrast, forwards further out the curve have not followed, and in fact 5y5y inflation pricing (on a beta- weighted basis) has remained under pressure in recent weeks (Exhibit 2)."

附注：“......中段盈亏平衡率的优异表现，一直是对美联储独立性担忧的更一致体现。按与名义利率的贝塔加权计算，5年期通胀互换继续重新定价，逼近疫情后的新高，虽然其中一部分归因于非常前端的定盘，但中段远期（例如2y1y）也有所参与。这一重新定价使得5年期通胀定价相较我们的公允价值模型高出约15个基点，尽管从历史上看，这种程度的高估并不罕见。相比之下，更长期限的远期并未跟随，事实上，5y5y通胀定价（按贝塔加权计算）在最近几周仍承受压力（见图表2）。”
Source: Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research, Goldman Sachs FICC and Equities

This message has been prepared by personnel in the Goldman Sachs FICC and Equities business units of one or more affiliates of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. ("Goldman Sachs") and is not the product of Global Investment Research. It is not a research report and is not intended as such.
